analysis: The documents all pertain to labor disputes within the transportation industry, specifically involving railroads and airlines. The disputes have not been resolved through the Railway Labor Act and threaten to disrupt interstate commerce. In response, the President establishes a board of three members to investigate the disputes and report findings within 30 days. During the investigation and for a period after the report, no changes can be made to the conditions that caused the dispute.
title: Presidential Intervention in Transportation Labor Disputes
